intro: Bonellia stenophylloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bonellia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its botanical features include a slender stem and woody roots, which help it thrive in the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Bonellia stenophylloides is often found in shaded, moist environments within the forest understory.
